title._content: [Demonstration garden, Bryant Park, 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Demonstration garden, Bryant Park, 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue, New York, New York. Visitors studying gardening notices] [1918 August] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Landscape: National War Garden Commission. On slide: Blue star sticker and red-edged square sticker with line through middle. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Photo shows men in garden sponsored by the National War Garden Commission during World War I. High rise buildings in background with a Chesterfield cigarettes advertisement on a billboard. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16688 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 44
